From Mrs. Parker and the Cafeteria Staff:

I want to let everyone know that we Really appreciate everyone who takes the time to come pick up meals. We realize that it takes a bit of your valuable time to do this BUT we really are happy to see you and know that we are doing a little part in helping out our families.

Please remember that pick ups are Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 8-10 am. If you cannot get here until a bit after please text me, 325 218-2659 and I will be happy to have them ready for you.

Please stop by and see us and get some meals for your kiddos, it is such a pleasure for us to be able to provide this service to our families. Everything is individually wrapped and microwave ready to make things a bit easier and to supplement the groceries that you are able to get. It is perfect for grandparents and babysitters. Also, for parents who are already Really busy!

This service is free to all children 18 and younger and they do not have to be enrolled at Mason ISD.

Together we are strong, we are Mason! Thanks to all. Take care and stay safe! Julie Parker

From Nurse Moneyhon:
Please encourage students to wash hands frequently throughout the day. This is the single best action that we can do to prevent illnesses. (There are some great YouTube videos for the little ones to watch before practicing.)
Do NOT come to school with a fever of 100.4 or more within the past 24 hours. This is without the use of fever reducing medications. You are at a greater risk of getting sicker and others are at a greater risk of you spreading the illness to them.
Keep unwashed hands away from your eyes, nose, and mouth. Use a tissue when available and dispose it properly.
When coughing, turn your head away from people AND cough into your elbow . Praise students for using correct germ etiquette. To decrease your risk of illness, it is best to avoid drinking and eating after your friends/family. We can all do our part to help clean our areas. Thank you for helping by cleaning frequently used items like door knobs and desks throughout the day.

**New Elementary/Junior High Principal**

We are excited to welcome Mr. Ryan Holbrook to Mason ISD!

Mr. Holbrook has been named as the Mason EL/JH Principal for the 2019-2020 school year.

Mr. Holbrook comes to us from Comal ISD where he has served as an Assistant Principal at Arlon Seay Elementary for the past six years. His teaching experiences include seven years as a 6th-8th grade Science teacher and one year as a 5th grade Science teacher with Comal ISD.

Please join us in giving him and his family a warm Mason Puncher welcome!

Everyone enjoy your last few weeks of summer and we look forward to seeing you all soon!

post_text: Tonight at Meet the Teacher, there will be a booth set up for a new program called Book Punchers. This is a cooperative effort of our Mason County Library and the Mason Study Club. The goal is to get parents of children birth to Pre-K to read at least 100 books this school year! They will receive a precious back pack with a free book inside. For every 25 books read, they can bring back their reading log and receive a beautiful new book! Hopefully this will get books into homes! So, if you or anyone you know has a child in this age group find the booth and sign up! They will also be working with Steady Steps and Head Start. We appreciate these groups trying to encourage reading!
